title: Antimicrobial activity of cranberry juice (Vaccinium macrocarponL.) ethanol extract against uropathogenic bacteria.
abstract: Cranberry fruit (Vaccinium macrocarponL) contains a mixture of phytochemicals such as flavonoids which consist of flavonoids, anthocyanins, proanthocyanidins, catechins, phenolic acids, and triterpenoids, all of which have possible antimicrobial (antibacterial, antifungal, and antiviral) activity.
